Name: Shadow of Glory
QuestDesc:
The Maiden left the tower without saying goodbye. Follow her trail to the land of glory.
Seek victory in the city of glory while searching for tales hidden in shadow.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (...?! That felt like a strong energy fluctuation from Cartethyia's Sonoro, the Inverted Tower...)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Her frequency is unstable… I should go check on her.)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What set off this huge energy surge? There are traces of Cartethyia's Resonance Energy discharge everywhere...

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What a MESS! This place looks like it was just bombarded!

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Sniffs) Yep, that's definitely Cartethyia's residual frequencies. Where did she go?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There are traces of a Resonance Energy discharge everywhere...

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What a MESS! This place looks like it was just bombarded!

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yep, that's definitely Cartethyia's residual frequencies. Where did she go?

Chapters.Title: Go to the location where the burst of energy originated
Go to the location where the burst of energy originated

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No response.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Can you tell where these traces lead, Abby?

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Over there. But the traces are kinda messy. They feel unsteady too...

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That way… That's the archipelago across from Ragunna.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The traces are still fresh. We should follow them to find Cartethyia before they fade.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Should we go now?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes. With the Threnodian's will gone, she wouldn't lose contact unless something's wrong. Really wrong.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But before we go…

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Your attempts to contact Cartethyia go unanswered. The only clue left is a faint flicker of her energy's explosion, pointing towards a cluster of islands opposite Ragunna.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, a call from the honored Laureate {Male=himself;Female=herself}. What is it? Missing the serenity of my castle, I presume?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Cartethyia is missing… I see.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It is indeed a rather urgent issue.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Go on, what is it you wish to ask of me?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I want to learn more about the archipelago before I set off to find her.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah, caution is indeed a virtue. Since you're in a hurry, I'll spare you the lengthy details.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That archipelago is called Septimont.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's another city-state within Rinascita. Like us Ragunnesi, its people were guided by the Sentinel across vast seas to settle there.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But over time, Septimont and Ragunna's differences led to a rift. Each one forged its own path.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What kind of differences?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Septimontians don't believe in the Sentinel.

Options.PlotLineKey: I thought it was a common faith across Rinascita.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Even from a shared origin, the hearts and minds of people can diverge in unexpected ways.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Septimont is a city of warriors. Its creed is simple "All for glory, fear no death." They revere heroes, not the Divinity.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Under The Order's control, Ragunna enforces strict border controls for Septimontians, but Septimont places no such barriers for the Ragunnesi.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You could say that Septimont has a far more accepting attitude toward outlanders.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: At present, Septimont is hosting the Great Agon, a cornerstone in the city's economy. Such a season draws visitors from far and wide.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sounds like the perfect time to visit Septimont. Thank you, Cantarella.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cantarella
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You're the Fisalias' eternal ally... and of course, my esteemed guest. No need for formalities between us.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Look! A wingray right here!

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It can give us a lift.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm, my heart's racing like crazy...

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Do you feel sick?

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Not really, I just have this uneasy feeling.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Uneasy? Did you sense something dangerous in Septimont?

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I don't know how to put it. It's strange, like things are all tangled up somehow...

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Abby, we've arrived. How do you feel now?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Abby?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Nothing from my Tacet Mark. Is it sleeping? Or is it...)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Cartethyia helped with Abby's symptoms before... I could really use her help now.)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (We share the same thread of Imperator's power. I could try using that to sense where she is.)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (What's that creature she's facing? A half-human, half-lion Tacet Discord? Or a special Echo?)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (She was here before.)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (I'll follow this same path and see if I can find someone to talk to.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As your fingers touch the cold statue, the whispers of fallen heroes ring through your mind.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The clash of weapons mingles with battle cries and hearty laughter. Amid these sounds, the <te href=850166>Hero's Legacy Armor</te> murmurs its late master's eternal longing for glory...

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (That armor might be an Echo.)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (An Echo... that awaits a true warrior.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
Since arriving in Septimont, Abby has remained silent within your Tacet Mark.

You try to sense Cartethyia but are confronted with an unbelievable vision—Cartethyia facing a half-human, half-lion creature.

Following her tracks, you head toward a sculpture beneath a stone wall where you find the Hero's Legacy Armor.

Chapters.Title: Split the Resonance of Past Battle

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (It seems happy. Is it because I'm reminding it of past battles?)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Looks like I've made my first friend here.)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So… this is Septimont.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The wind at your side carries a trace of Cartethyia. It grazes your ear as it passes, then slips away into the deeper dark, where the shadows thicken and forgotten secrets lie in wait.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The traces will guide you here, {PlayerName}.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And, when the time comes, you'll bring this story to its rightful end.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The scent of seawater... It's right ahead.

Chapters.Title: Go to the location of the experimental unit

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Found you.

Chapters.Title: Go to the village to gather information

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (There's a village up ahead. I'll go talk to some locals.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Excited Villager
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ha, I knew it! The Blue Furies remain undefeated!

Dialogues.Speaker: Excited Villager
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah, folk always write 'em off, thinking they're just sailors or singers. That don't matter in the arena. It's all about pure strength.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cautious Villager
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Most of the teams in this year's finals aren't even backed by local nobles.

Dialogues.Speaker: Excited Villager
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So what? Worried about your bets? How many times do I have to—

Dialogues.Speaker: Cautious Villager
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Aye.

Dialogues.Speaker: Excited Villager
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Alright, alright... Oh, look here, a visitor! Welcome to Septimont!

Dialogues.Speaker: Excited Villager
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Your clothes aren't from around here. You from the New Federation?

Options.PlotLineKey: Actually, I'm from the Black Shores.
From the endless void I come...

Dialogues.Speaker: Excited Villager
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah, I've met some visitors from Huanglong before. Proper folk, polite as can be. They do tend to speak in riddles though!

Dialogues.Speaker: Excited Villager
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm... sounds familiar, but I can't say I know where that is.

Dialogues.Speaker: Excited Villager
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Makin' jokes already? I like your style! Anyway, enjoy your stay here, friend!

Options.PlotLineKey: What were you talking about just now?
About the finals you were discussing…

Dialogues.Speaker: Excited Villager
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We just watched a live match. Too bad you missed it. Mattia from the Blue Furies gave the other team a right pounding!

Dialogues.Speaker: Cautious Villager
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Aye. <te href=850167>Capitoline Hill</te>'s holding the <te href=850149>Great Agon</te> now in the city. Happens every four years. All of Septimont's talkin' about who'll be the next champion. You here for the games too?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No, I'm looking for someone.

Dialogues.Speaker: Excited Villager
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: At this time? That might be tricky. Folks from all over Solaris are floodin' into Septimont lately!

Dialogues.Speaker: Cautious Villager
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Who's it you're looking for? This here is the first stop for ferries heading to Capitoline Hill. Maybe we've seen them before.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cautious Villager
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Can't say I've seen anyone like that around.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cautious Villager
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Most Ragunnesi we see here are from the Troupe of Fools or the Montelli nobles. They're a bit more open to our ways of thinking about faith.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cautious Villager
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If she's wearing the Order's emblem, though, she'll have drawn some eyes.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (After Cartethyia and Fleurdelys's frequencies merged, she got her body back. If she passed through here, people would've seen her.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Excited Villager
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A half-human, half-lion creature wearin' armor and swingin' a poleaxe? That's gotta be the <te href=850168>Guardian Echo</te> of Septimont, our Lioness of Glory, Arsinosa!

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Can you tell me more about this Guardian Echo?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cautious Villager
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Gladly! See, ever since our ancestors set foot on this land, we Septimontians have fought the harsh elements and the savage Tacet Discords.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cautious Villager
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Many brave souls came before us, their Reverberations settlin' in the stone that now stands as <ano=Lioness of Glory>Arsinosa</ano>. She was born from the battle's roar and the fierce bellows of pride.

Dialogues.Speaker: Excited Villager
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As the guardian of Septimont, Arsinosa usually only reveals herself during the Great Agon. To earn her blessing is the highest honor any Septimontian could hope for!

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (But... why would Cartethyia take on Septimont's Guardian Echo?)

Dialogues.Speaker: Excited Villager
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If you want to see her, just wait for the finals. They'll be held in the Colosseum in the city. But don't dawdle, get a ticket now or you'll miss out!

Dialogues.Speaker: Cautious Villager
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As for that Order girl you're looking for, you might try askin' in the inns around the city...

Dialogues.Speaker: Busy Septimotian
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Clay! Edwin! Come give me a hand!

Dialogues.Speaker: Cautious Villager
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah, right, we best be off. If you want to see the fights, follow this path to the arena. The ticket booth's just up ahead.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
In the first village you reach in Septimont, you find no leads on Cartethyia.

However, you do learn that the half-human, half-lion Guardian you saw, the mighty Arsinosa, will appear in the city's Agon of Champions. Held every four years, it is the biggest Gladiatorial event in Septimont.

The match will be held at the Colosseum on Septimont's hilltop, and you plan to continue your investigation there.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Its frequency is similar to the Echoes in Ragunna. Could it have originated from Imperator's power as well?)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (But it's unstable, as if something else is interfering... Strange, it's just like Abby said.)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (I can feel its source close to the city, but can't pin down where exactly.)
Boss, you're looking so serious!

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And you are...?

Dialogues.Speaker: Buling
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Me? I'm a traveling Taoist from <te href=850154>Mengzhou</te>. Just call me Buling.

Dialogues.Speaker: Buling
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Exorcism, talisman divination, fortune-telling... you name it, I "bling" it! So {PlayerName}, you want to try your luck fah?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How did you know my name?

Dialogues.Speaker: Buling
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Heard about you from an old friend. You know Jianxin? Pretty sure you met her in Jinzhou. She trained with the same master before me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Buling
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We've got history. Last time I went up to the mountain to see her, she mentioned you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Buling
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So I hear you're looking for someone? Tsk, not so easy, not so easy. The feng shui in Rinascita is not good.

Dialogues.Speaker: Buling
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Qi is trapped underwater, not good flow. No luck now, bad sign. You should be careful, Boss!

Dialogues.Speaker: Buling
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You show up and the stars change... I was betting on who could break the deadlock, so I'm glad I caught you first.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
You encounter a young Taoist girl named Buling, who claims to be from Mengzhou.

She seems to have sought you out deliberately, but after a few cryptic exchanges, she vanishes without a trace.

Chapters.Title: (Optional) Ask Septimontians about their opinions of the Sentinel

Dialogues.Speaker: Kind Septimontian
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: To us Septimontians, They are a strong comrade in arms. They are also the guide who led us to our new homeland.

Dialogues.Speaker: Kind Septimontian
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Like the Ragunnesi, our ancestors were displaced and forced to sail through stormy seas. But I think that was a test of our strength.

Dialogues.Speaker: Kind Septimontian
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It tempered our bodies and minds, teaching us that humanity itself is the true hero of Septimont. Only the strongest can stand beside the Sentinel and fight.

Dialogues.Speaker: Kind Septimontian
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Without the blood spilled and sweat shed, Septimont would've known no peace, no stability.

Dialogues.Speaker: Kind Septimontian
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But the Ragunnesi lost their way, treating the Sentinel like some kind of divinity. They forget it's the strength of people that counts.

Dialogues.Speaker: Kind Septimontian
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's just cowardice. An easy escape.

Dialogues.Speaker: Kind Septimontian
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Here, if we build statues, it's to honor the heroes of the hunt.

Dialogues.Speaker: Kind Septimontian
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm... though, I've heard things are changing over there in Ragunna lately...

Chapters.Title: (Optional) Ask Septimontians about their opinions of the Lioness of Glory

Dialogues.Speaker: Senior Septimontian
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You want to know about Arsinosa? She's the heart of our land.

Dialogues.Speaker: Senior Septimontian
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If you visit the downtown area on Capitoline Hill, you'll see it for yourself. The Gryphon statues are everywhere.

Dialogues.Speaker: Senior Septimontian
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They've been part of this archipelago since ancient times. We used to fight them, but we've always respected their strength and bravery.

Dialogues.Speaker: Senior Septimontian
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In Septimont, strong emotional frequencies tend to settle within things. That's how Arsinosa came to be.

Dialogues.Speaker: Senior Septimontian
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: She was once just a Gryphon statue, but the people's burning desire for victory transformed her into Septimont's Iudicis Echo.

Dialogues.Speaker: Senior Septimontian
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's a kind of... testament to our will!

Dialogues.Speaker: Senior Septimontian
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I've heard that the Sentinel came to Septimont not long after Arsinosa was born.

Dialogues.Speaker: Senior Septimontian
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's said They even met her... I can't help but wonder what happened. As the Sentinel's fellow warriors, we Septimontians pay heed to Their actions.

Dialogues.Speaker: Senior Septimontian
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But after that, it was the last time the Sentinel came to Septimont.

Dialogues.Speaker: Senior Septimontian
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Maybe They saw we could handle things on our own and decided to entrust the city to our ancestors.

Dialogues.Speaker: Senior Septimontian
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If that's the case, it's a grand honor, don't you think?

Dialogues.Speaker: Senior Septimontian
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah, Arsinosa... she will stand watch over our land now and forever.
Sniff... Hm?
Not bad!
Think you can keep me from fighting?
Careful now...
We'll see who rips whose throat out first.
Alright, Emilio. Why don't you take your band of cowards and get out of my way before I decide to handle it myself?
Pulling dirty tricks before the Agon... did you think I wouldn't notice? Did you ever stop to think you nearly got an innocent person killed? Shame on you!

Dialogues.Speaker: Emilio
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Lupa… so you're really not gonna reconsider? Even with the finals just around the corner?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Reconsider? Ha! You think I should keep playing along and stay blind to your match-fixing?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I don't care what you do off the field, but in the arena, fairness isn't negotiable. If you can't get that, just keep wagging your tail for the house...

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You know, I once thought you were a decent Gladiator, and we fought well together. But look at you now. Pathetic.

Dialogues.Speaker: Emilio
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You—! You know nothing, Lupa.

Dialogues.Speaker: Emilio
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Not everyone has the same strength to survive in Septimont with a clean conscience.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sorry about that clown show. Don't judge Septimont by a few rats that can't hold their own in the dirt. They're not the norm here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Lupa's the name. <te href=850164>Gladiator</te> by trade. Guess we're acquainted now after crossing blades. Care to tell me your name?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Got it. It's rare to meet someone with your kind of strength.

Options.PlotLineKey: I take down Tacets Discords every day.
Thanks. Your moves are impressive too.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Combat makes the greatest warriors. You're a fine example of that.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah, so you like hunting Tacet Discords? Then you've come to the right place.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm used to fighting the Gladiators here, but the way you handled your blade... it's beautiful. I like it.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What happened just now? Did they try to ambush you?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Heh... just about. That man, Emilio, used to be my partner. <te href=850169>The Silvas</te> were probably behind this.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The House of Silva is nobility in Septimont. I share their name, though, I'm sure they've thrown me out since I stepped away from the team.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Is this tied to the match-fixing you mentioned?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes. I knew something was off, but I didn't think they'd go this far. Maybe they threw some serious money at it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I thought the money I made them would've been enough. Oh well!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I was thinking, you're not a local, are you? How about—

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We team up and fight together in the finals?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (That's Cartethyia's frequency... but how?)

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Huh? {PlayerName}, is that your way of saying yes?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm sorry. Lupa, have you ever met a Ragunnesi girl by the name of Cartethyia?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Cartethyia... No, never heard of her. What's going on with her?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: She's missing. I'm looking for her.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I tracked her to Septimont, and… it seems she confronted Arsinosa.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Arsinosa is the symbol of our spirit, the great Echo guarding Septimont for centuries. Besides the current <te href=850157>Ephor</te>, Augusta, nobody has ever faced her directly.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I don't know if this Cartethyia of yours is strong enough to take on Arsinosa. If she did, it would be the talk of Septimont.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I see… no leads yet, then.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well, that's why you should join me in the Agon. When Arsinosa shows up in the finals, you might find the answers you're looking for.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The champion gets noble recognition, a hefty bonus, and some secret perks. If we win, you can take it all.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If that doesn't interest you, then the attention that comes with being a champion will help you find the information you need on her.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: True. But what's in it for you?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Me? I just want to see the look on their cheating faces when they realize I've beaten them at their own game!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They're probably betting against me in secret. Ha, doesn't matter. Once we win, they'll lose it all. Serves 'em right.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If there's no punishment for crossing the line, then what's the point of a line at all?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I don't know what other tricks my dear family has planned, but you? You're an outlander. Strong, too. No ties to their schemes.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's why I look forward to walking this path with you. Can't wait to see what kind of Gladiator you'll be!

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Arsinosa and the unusual frequency I felt from Lupa are the only leads I've got…)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Lupa denies ever meeting Cartethyia, but maybe she didn't realize... or she's hiding something.)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Either way, teaming up with her is my best shot at finding the truth.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's the spirit! Well then...  I'll be counting on you, my fellow warrior.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now, let's go register our <te href=850155>team</te>!

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
You meet a young Gladiator named Lupa. Once part of a Gladiator team, she left after learning about her House's involvement in match-fixing. She recognizes your strength and invites you to team up.

You sense a faint trace of Cartethyia's frequency on Lupa, but she denies ever meeting her.

To learn the truth and because Arsinosa will appear in the finals, you accept Lupa's invitation to join her in the arena.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hi there. Is team registration still open?

Dialogues.Speaker: Boethia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: May applause greet you. Yes, you can register... Oh wait, you're Contender Lupa!

Dialogues.Speaker: Boethia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Do you... wish to register a new team? But aren't you...

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Plans changed. I'm no longer with the Bough of Legions. This is my new partner, {PlayerName}.

Dialogues.Speaker: Boethia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah... I see. Allow me to register you again. Have you settled on a name for your new team?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm… {PlayerName}, why don't you do the honors?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We Septimontians live alongside the waves, and I've always found their sound soothing. A perfect choice!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Haha, I take it you are referring to the two of us. The star does suit you well.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Haha, simple but powerful! A good omen for us, too.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Alright, the name is settled. We'd also like to apply for the special qualifier, please.

Dialogues.Speaker: Boethia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Of course. Please wait one moment.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The <te href=850165>Gladiator's Agon</te> happens year-round in Septimont. Training matches, exhibition games, open tournaments, you name it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But we're after the Agon of Champions, the biggest event held every four years. We also call it the Great Agon.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There are two stages: a points-based prelim and an elimination round. The prelim is almost over. The eliminations are about to begin.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I've earned enough points from the regular matches to qualify for the finals, but since you're a new contender, you'll need to win the special qualifier to make it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If we defeat higher-ranked opponents, we can secure a spot with fewer matches.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Just the two of us? Is it two-on-two?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Exactly. It's one of the reforms the new Ephor made to the Agon. And of course, our Echo partners will be joining us in the arena too!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Echoes aren't just companions to us, but proof of our strength. Hunting them, taming them, and learning to live with them is the first lesson every Septimontian learns.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now, it's time to step into the arena. Ready?

Dialogues.Speaker: Boethia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Registration completed. Happy hunting, contenders!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let's see how well we work together in the arena, my fellow warrior.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You and Lupa register a new team and ready for your first battle together.

Dialogues.Speaker: Hermilia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Are you ready for the Gladiator's Agon?

Dialogues.Speaker: Hermilia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Happy hunting, Gladiators!

Dialogues.Speaker: Hermilia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Very well. I'll be waiting for you here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Hermilia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {Cus:Var,VarType=Global Key=main_team_name} versus Vulcan Mining.

Dialogues.Speaker: Hermilia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let the Agon begin!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We did it!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That was perfection! Haven't felt this alive in ages.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I could finally focus and savor every moment of the fight…

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thanks, warrior. Teaming up with you was the right choice.

Options.PlotLineKey: You flatter me. I enjoyed it just as much.
Fighting alongside Echoes was an entirely new thrill.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And these are...?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ta-das. These little ones love a good match and never miss a chance to cheer for the victors.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They're more fired up than usual. Looks like your performance really won them over, {PlayerName}.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They're just as lively as the baby Gryphon I came across before.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This city does know how to keep spirits high! Speaking of Gryphons, they've actually been here long before our ancestors even settled on this archipelago.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Anyway, we've secured our first victory. The next match will be held further out.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If we take down the top-ranked team there, we'll be… Huh?

Dialogues.Speaker: Eager Spectator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: CONTENDER LUPA! PLEASE SIGN FOR ME!

Dialogues.Speaker: Flustered Spectator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I-it's you… in the flesh! Why-why would a star like you be in this arena?

Dialogues.Speaker: Flustered Spectator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's impossible to get a ticket for your matches... Ugh, I wish I'd known sooner that you'd be here!

Dialogues.Speaker: Discerning Spectator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Did something happen with the Bough of Legions, Contender Lupa? Who's this new Gladiator you've got with you? Did you replace Contender Emilio?

Dialogues.Speaker: Discerning Spectator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, that's front-page material...

Dialogues.Speaker: Eager Spectator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hey, make some room! LUPA! I LOVED YOUR PERFORMANCE! PLEASE, WILL YOU SIGN FOR ME?!！

Options.PlotLineKey: You're quite a celebrity around here, Lupa!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm sorry. It's been too long since I've fought outside the Colosseum. Should've worn a helmet.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It comes with the job. Gotta draw a crowd in, both in and out of the arena.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Don't worry! I'm confident we'll claim the title. Soon enough, you'll be signing autographs 'til your hand bleeds.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Alright, everyone…

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Uh... I-I can handle this, but it'll take too long.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We need to make a swift retreat.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Okay, but how?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Easy. Just hold my hand and don't let go!

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
You and Lupa secure your first victory. But as her supporters and fans swarm you, the weight of her fame as a Gladiator comes crashing down.

To avoid lingering too long, Lupa laughs and takes your hand, pulling you away from the arena.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hah... hah... Haha! Good, we made it out!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'll let the staff at the next arena know we're coming to avoid the same chaos there.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Matches are the bread and butter for Gladiators. The famous ones rarely take on impromptu matches. That's what caused such a stir.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But now… word about our new team is going to spread very quickly.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What was that smirk about?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, me? I just... sent word to certain people.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Too much modesty is a double-edged sword, so I'll be frank. When it comes to bankability, I'm at the top of the game.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's how my family, the Silvas, have kept their position all these years. But the nobles here in Septimont are always hunting and contesting for more.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Lions and wolves tear each other to pieces, while the hyenas lie in wait, eyes on their bellies. Everyone wants a taste of the juiciest meat.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And with the illegal betting they're running... Once they hear I've left the old team, they'll all be scrambling to get a piece of the action.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Are you planning to muddy the waters?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The waters are already so murky no one can tell who's stirring them.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But it's still better now than it was before. The mess they made before the current Ephor took over was...
May applause greet you, Lupa.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ha... I see you've been waiting for me, Cartur.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: He was my manager back in the Bough of Legions. Has a gift for knowing exactly what to say to anyone, though that's his flaw, too.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartur
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: For a manager, isn't the skill of speech always a gift?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartur
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Domina Julia Silva hoped you'd behave and return home. She bid that I reason with you at the earliest opportunity.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartur
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But... it seems you've found yourself a new ally. I daresay her hopes are dashed.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And? What's your point?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartur
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How disappointing. Not even a hint of charm when there's no crowd around to impress.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartur
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Feeling confident about this new team of yours? What do you think your chances are of winning the championship?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: With me and {PlayerName}? One hundred percent.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Enough, Cartur. Spare me the games and empty chatter! I have one question for you...

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Are you involved in the Silvas' match-fixing?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartur
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No. I do love money, but I don't stoop to that level to get it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Fair enough. You may leave now.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartur
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Tut, tut, dangerous question, Lupa. Think carefully. The Silvas may have made you a star, but they can just as easily snuff that star out.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartur
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I've never doubted your talent, but these are the rules of the game.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I know the rules well enough.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...I just wonder if Domina Julia truly understands who's making the rules now, and where she stands in this game.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
Lupa's former manager, Cartur, waits for her by the road, but it's clear Lupa has no intention of returning to fight for her patron House.

The power struggles between Septimont's noble Houses simmer beneath the surface as the Great Agon unfolds.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Is this Cartur also from House Silva?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Not exactly. He's a free man, though he's handled Bough of Legions business for the past few years.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Look, {PlayerName}. Once we cross the Hero's Way, we'll get to the Capitoline Hill district.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: For centuries, countless Gladiators have walked this very path to Colosseum Olymdos... just as we are now.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The next qualifier is just ahead. Once it's over, we can take the cable car to the upper city!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: On an autumn day, the view as you ascend and the breeze on your face can truly lift your spirits.

Dialogues.Speaker: Valius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Are you ready for the Gladiator's Agon?

Dialogues.Speaker: Valius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Happy hunting, Gladiators!

Dialogues.Speaker: Valius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Of course. I'll be right here waiting.

Dialogues.Speaker: Valius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {Cus:Var,VarType=Global Key=main_team_name} versus Blue Furies.

Dialogues.Speaker: Valius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let the Agon begin!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Fierce attacks. Shame it's only exposing your weaknesses.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hahaha! Great work! Your skill is fueling my bloodlust, {PlayerName}!

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Cartethyia... standing on the water?)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (That abnormal sensation came over me again when my sword struck the contender's Echo. )

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (All the Echoes in Septimont seem to exhibit unstable power. Something is definitely off.)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (But it seems like no one else has noticed.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Whispering Spectator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Contender Lupa isn't in the Bough of Legions anymore... what a shame.

Dialogues.Speaker: Doubtful Spectator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Just two days before the finals, as well! It's unfair to her former teammates and her fans.

Dialogues.Speaker: Whispering Spectator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Is it about the money? She's changed teammates how many times now? As for that newcomer next to her...

Dialogues.Speaker: Scornful Specatator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Without the Silvas' patronage, there's no way a gladiator from the outskirts could rise to fame so quickly.

Dialogues.Speaker: Disgruntled Spectator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Quiet down. Where are you hearing these rumors? Open your eyes, Lupa has never once thrown a match!

Dialogues.Speaker: Doubtful Spectator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmph, everyone thinks they know the real truth. But consider this, it's a fact I know to be true...

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let's go, my fellow warrior.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's all going as planned! Let's get you settled somewhere comfortable, then tomorrow, we head to the Colosseum Olymdos for the semi-finals.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I've been meaning to ask, is there a body of water in the city? I think Cartethyia might've passed through there.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A body of water? Yes, but it's been abandoned for years. That elevator can take you to the upper city, though.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If you want to try looking for her, we can start there!

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thanks. And…

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Those people just now… they talked about match-fixing. Don't you want to challenge that?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I didn't have time to gather enough proof before I left. Besides, this isn't the right moment.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Once we win the Great Agon, I'll make everything public. In Septimont, only the winners get to speak their truth.

Options.PlotLineKey: Their slander gets under my skin.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hehe, I'm fine. High praise leads to harsh words. It's always like that.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Heh, a strong warrior with a kind heart... Rare traits for a hunter.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Honestly, I don't care what people say. This kind of thing happens every day in Septimont. If you can't handle it, you won't last.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Tarnishing rivals' reputations is one of their usual tricks. I cut off their betting profits, so it's only natural they'd be upset.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Besides, now I have a reliable warrior by my side. That's all that matters.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No worrying about whether my teammate can keep up, no dealing with petty politics... just the thrill of the fight.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you for that, {PlayerName}.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
After your victory in the second Agon, you sense Cartethyia's presence by the waters of Septimont, just as you notice the strange energy affecting Septimont's Echoes.

Meanwhile, Lupa's departure from House Silva sparks retaliatory rumors, but she appears unaffected, focused on helping your search for Cartethyia.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Why would the place you mentioned be abandoned?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Because of the first Dark Tide in Ragunna… Oh, you know what a Dark Tide is, right?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Due to certain safety concerns at the time, the main city district was relocated further up the hill.

Chapters.Title: Take the elevator inside the tower
Go to the top of the tower

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Beware of the Kerasaurs lurking below. Those Tacet Discords will ambush anyone who falls into the water.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Are those the city's ruins down there?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes, remnants of the Old District.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We rarely use this route since it's too dangerous. But some thrill-seekers come here to hunt Tacet Discords.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Speaking of which, this area is actually under Silva jurisdiction. I used to play here as a child.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You said Cartethyia might've been here. Do you have an idea where she passed through?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I think… somewhere over there.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah, that's where the statue of Tercules is.

Chapters.Title: Go to the body of water

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This is the place. I'll look for Cartethyia's traces here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Through... the connection we share.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Alright then. I'll wait here. Good luck!

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You call upon the power of Imperator, calling for the one who shares its essence.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The unique frequency pulses through your blade and spreads across the water in ripples. But the connection weakens, fading into the distance.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Cartethyia isn't here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How's it going? You look... frustrated.

Options.PlotLineKey: I'm okay. We still have the lead on Arsinosa.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Don't worry, we can follow the lead on Arsinosa.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's right! I'm sure you'll make progress by the finals.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Tercules… His statues once stood tall on both sides of the street, watching over the heroes of Septimont as they set out to hunt.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Back then, the chimes drifting up from the city were the finest sounds of glory.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You arrive at the waters where you felt Cartethyia's presence but still find no trace of her.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Kerasaurs here. Let's take them down!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Cartethyia...

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I've never heard that name before, but it feels strangely familiar...

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Someone's still alive.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Are you okay? You seem like a local… are there any other survivors?

Dialogues.Speaker: Nameless Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm managing. I-I can still move, but I'm exhausted. I've walked for so long, for so far... but I still can't leave this city.

Dialogues.Speaker: Nameless Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The white <te href=850161>Tidal Blight</te> follows me wherever I go.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Tidal Blight… could she mean the Dark Tide?)

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What's your name?

Dialogues.Speaker: Nameless Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I… don't remember.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's alright. Memories can be recovered, and so can your name. I've been through something similar myself, and someone helped me find my way back.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I've only just arrived here. All of Septimont is cloaked in mist. Would you mind sharing with me what you still remember?

Dialogues.Speaker: Nameless Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Who… are you?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: My name is Cartethyia. I'm Ragunna's…

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm a wandering knight from Ragunna.

Dialogues.Speaker: Nameless Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A wandering knight… ah.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Don't worry, I'll take care of them.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Come forth, and face my blade.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Welcome to my city, Gryphon's Fortress of Capitoline Hill!

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Who are they...?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, some minor noble houses that didn't make it into the Agon.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But in Septimont, strength and power go hand in hand. Nobles get more, but they better prove they're worth it and pull their weight for the city.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Agon isn't just about fortune. It's a way to find the capable. For nobles, the ability to command and control Echoes is a basic responsibility.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If the heir of a noble house isn't strong enough, it signals that the house is unfit to hunt down Tacet Discords or protect Septimont.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So... if a noble's been living it up, they'll end up broke and thrown out of the city after paying high patronage fees for a gladiator who doesn't even make the cut.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "Strength is everything." That's how it works. You've fought your battles too, or you wouldn't be here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Might not work like this everywhere, but here in Septimont, with the Dark Tide breathing down our necks, it's our survival code.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: For most Septimontians, the Agon isn't just an event. It's the training ground nobles and commoners alike have to fight in.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The victors show no mercy to the defeated. People here despise weakness, worship strength, and crave glory.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Where you come from don't matter. Prove yourself, and the crowd will scream your name. The spotlight's yours, the arena's your stage.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But if you can't can't keep up, if you're not chosen... you'll be left in the shadows.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
After coming to Septimont, you learn from Lupa just how important the arena is to the city. It can elevate someone to the heights of power or cast them into obscurity.

Meanwhile, in a side of the city unseen, Cartethyia walks beneath the shadowed skies of Septimont and meets the Nameless One.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Come to think of it, we haven't had anything to eat since those two matches.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Right, I know just the thing I want you to try!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, I can already smell it, can almost taste it...

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Fulvia! Two large platters please, with two bottles of <te href=850151>Heartpour</te>!

Dialogues.Speaker: Surprised Septimontian
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ohh! It's Lupa!

Dialogues.Speaker: Well-informed Septimontian
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I heard she left the Bough of Legions...

Dialogues.Speaker: Fulvia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's enough, folks. You know the rules, no gossip outside the arena.

Dialogues.Speaker: Fulvia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Just dig in!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Still got that fire, huh, Fulvia?

Dialogues.Speaker: Fulvia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You should talk. Finally cut ties with the Silvas, eh? With the way they handled the share of profits, you should've left sooner!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Haha… well, back then a strong backer was exactly what I needed. Can't say it was all bad.

Dialogues.Speaker: Fulvia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So, this is your new partner. Hmm... Looks like you can handle yourself.

Options.PlotLineKey: You can tell just by looking?
The most dependable one in all of Solaris, at your service.

Dialogues.Speaker: Fulvia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Can't keep a tavern running for long if you don't have a good eye.

Dialogues.Speaker: Fulvia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well, well, you better prove it in the Agon then.

Dialogues.Speaker: Fulvia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: By the way, Heartpour is sold out today. Guess the celebrity branding really worked.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What? Oh, come on...

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What's Heartpour?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A drink I endorsed. Most of the drinks I promoted were... Ahem. But this one's actually really good.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If my name's on it, you don't have to worry about quality. It's just that the taste... well, let's just say it's "meh" at best.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Anyway, I'll get you a taste of Heartpour later. For now, let's enjoy the meal!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So, fellow warrior, any stories to share? There is still much to learn about each other.

Dialogues.Speaker: Fulvia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hey Lupa, got a message from Old Appius. He said the new batch of restored footage just arrived, including those about Contender Mya.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh thanks! I almost forgot with everything going on lately.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Restored footage?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Recordings of major matches or famous contenders. Helpful for those who want to learn from them.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ephor Augusta's are the most popular. Four years ago, she became the champion and a household name by crushing every single opponent. From there, she worked her way up into the Ephor's seat.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But I prefer watching Contender Mya's matches over any of the past champions.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I think she's... got real heart.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You can feel it, even through the recordings. The way she threw herself into every fight.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Do you think we'll face her in this Agon?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ha, not likely. She disappeared during a Great Agon years ago.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Some say she got tangled up in illegal betting scandals. Others think the pressure from her manager drove her to leave Septimont... There are plenty of rumors, but no one knows what really happened.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Still, it's frustrating! To just disappear halfway through...

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If you fail to make it to the end, people will see you as nothing.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
You and Lupa go to a restaurant, drawing the stares of many.

Lupa mentions a former Gladiator she admires, Mya, a true competitor. However, Mya's career was cut short during the Great Agon two decades ago when she vanished under mysterious circumstances.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ta-da! Welcome to your new spot! It's a lifetime suite, and it's yours anytime you need it during your stay in Septimont.

Options.PlotLineKey: A lifetime suite? It must've cost a fortune!
Speaking of which, I own a room in the Black Shores too.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Don't mention it! The hotel owner sees us as future champions. Supporting us is an investment that'll pay off, of that I am certain.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ha, I've been a name in the arena for years now. I'm doing alright. Besides, it didn't hurt that the hotel owner gave me a nice discount.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Black Shores, huh? I'd love to see it one day. Maybe when the time's right, I'll venture beyond Septimont and explore the world out there.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You know... gladiating means everything to me!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I really, really love it... I know I'm lucky. I know what I want and I'm doing what I love.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Compared to those drifting through life, I've already been given so much. But sometimes...

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well, sometimes, I feel a little... afraid.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Haha, well, I'm not unhappy!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I was born for this. But the more I embrace it, the more I fear losing it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I can't help but wonder... What is it that fills me up when I'm under those lights? My passion for the fight? Or the favor it brings me?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If one day I lost that favor... would I be more helpless, panicked, and heartbroken than those who never had it in the first place?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If that day comes, would I still be able to say, "I love this life?"

Options.PlotLineKey: You would if you truly love it.
Even if you wouldn't, you shouldn't blame yourself for it.
That's something only you can figure out.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You're right... I hope that love never fades. Not until I'm buried in the Vale of Glory.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you. You're kind. I'll try not to dwell on it. Still, sometimes I feel... guilty. Why should I be so lucky when others aren't?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Haha! Well said. It's my life to live, my path to walk. If I don't make my choices, who will? That's how you live without regrets.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Tomorrow is the semi-finals. We'd best get some rest, {PlayerName}.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Night, my fellow warrior.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
Lupa books you into her lifetime suite. Now, no matter when you return to Septimont, you will always have a place to stay.

She confides her worry: Is the joy she finds in the arena due to her passion for it, or because of the favor it brings her?

As she says goodnight and leaves, you see her suddenly transform into another young woman. It lasts only a moment, like a fleeting illusion.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
You lie down in the soft bed, the phonograph beside you lulling you to sleep.
As the foreign yet familiar melody plays, you drift into a deep slumber...

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Solis never disappoints! Their dishes hit the spot every time! Now that our bellies are full, time to relax.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: To Leonidas Hotel! It's the best place for travelers in Septimont. I've got a long-term rental there myself.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Words? Lines of them, all around me...)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (...And music coming from above.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This is but an illusion. One of the night, one of dreams. Not like the spectacle you saw in the glimmer of the Carnevale.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Here, I am not your foe, nor can we harm each other, should we so wish. Lay your blade to rest, if only for now. Tis' a pleasure to see you again, {PlayerName}, on this special stage.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A city wild and beautiful, chasing endless glory... Tell me, does Septimont please you as much as Ragunna once did?

Options.PlotLineKey: Let's cut to the chase. You're connected to Cartethyia's disappearance.
Has the Fractsidus's hand already reached Septimont?

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah, so it is she you seek. It appears this special Resonator has you rather captivated.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: When one wrestles against the torrents of fate, every signpost is an anchor guiding you toward the infinite horizon.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let's take our time. I would like our talk to be pleasant. No one will bother us here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I have an associate who adores the heroic tales told throughout this land.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: For this reason...  the missing girl you seek and the anomaly you sensed in Septimont, they are indeed threads in his tapestry.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You could call it... an obsession of his.

Options.PlotLineKey: Stop beating around the bush. Tell me what you really came to say.
Tell me what the Fractsidus is planning.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Every hero's tale begins with a trial.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Your wisdom and courage, your compassion and resolve, your hope and madness... Will they be strong enough to carry you through the trial? To make you the hero of this story?

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Read it. I hope this story speaks to you. The answers you seek lie within these pages.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If we continue to meet as foes, the symphony grows monotonous. I confess I find it... rather uninspired.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'll ask again, Phrolova. What are you doing here in Septimont, and why give me this?

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm giving this story a little nudge.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As of now, you and that Blessed Maiden from the tower are deeply interwoven in the fate he has spun.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So you're not the only Overseer active in Rinascita.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Scar, your nameless ally, and you... The Fractsidus seems to revel in the company of those with twisted obsessions.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's not as you imagine. You've already met my associate, you see. He trusts what he sees, not the words of others.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (I've already crossed paths with him since arriving in Rinascita…?)

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As a creator, he always hopes his characters will craft twists and turns that he himself cannot foresee.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: He believes that the closer one stands to the protagonist, the greater their influence over the tale.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But the true lead of this story has yet to emerge.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I gave you this <te href=850153>play</te> so you can see the ending. That Gladiator girl will be the harbinger of the Dark Tide in Septimont.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: All glory will be consumed, and the pride of heroes will dissolve within a blackened maelstrom. Such is the finale "she" holds most dear.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This is a short story, {PlayerName}. One that only lasts three days. When the final match concludes, so too will this story.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You could claim the spotlight by ending her life before the curtain falls. Change the ending, and the tragedy is averted.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But should you falter, or worse, warn her of what's to come, the consequences will spiral far beyond anything you can imagine.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What you're proposing I do... Tell me, what reason do I have to trust a word you're saying, Phrolova?

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You don't need to trust me. Let my words slip from your thoughts, if you wish. As I've already said, the story will unfold as my associate has written it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The choice lies with you, {PlayerName}. It is a freedom we all hold.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Even the wildest imaginations draw from what already exists.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So it is with this story. It follows a template, and even its creator cannot escape its confines.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Choose wisely, {PlayerName}. Time is still on your side, for now.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I look forward to your performance in this grand finale.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
In your dreams, you see Phrolova floating in the air with pages swirling around her.

Phrolova gives you a play that contains an account of the future. You don't believe her, but she seems indifferent.

She tells you that Lupa will be the one to trigger the Dark Tide's surge in Septimont, and it will happen within three days.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
Phrolova offers a faint smile that carries a hint of some unknown expectation.
It feels like you've fallen into the velvety embrace of a Lycoris. When you open your eyes again, the bustling noise of the Great Agon surrounds you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Morning, {PlayerName}!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Hmm? You don't exactly look well rested.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Phrolova may not have told the whole truth, but there's no denying the anomaly here in Septimont. And neither Lupa nor the others here seem to notice.)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (And that fleeting image… Lupa turning into that unfamiliar girl... I need more clues before making any decisions.)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm fine. Just a bad dream. Let's get going, our next stop is the Colosseum Olymdos, right?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You got it! Let's get going!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As expected, the Silvas chose to face us in the semi-finals. The news spreads quickly.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You knew this was coming?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Of course. To them, it's a provocation... and to forfeit would be a disgrace.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Domina Julia must be here. She wouldn't miss a moment like this.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: She's shrewd and exceptionally capable but arrogant to the core. She's convinced that she's always right.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: She doesn't believe in talking things through, thinks it's for the weak. So we'll show her we don't need rigged matches to win. We'll win with pure stength!

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Four years have passed, and I stand before you once more. Not as a Gladiator, but as a witness to the start of this grand event.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You all know well that Gladiatorial combat is the lifeblood of our ancient and mighty city.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "Seize power, and fight for victory."

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Once, we fought to survive on the seas. That same instinct courses through our veins today. The instinct to face fate head-on and defy it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Remember, those who cling to glory without the strength to defend it will see it slip through their fingers.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Warriors! By the eternal sun, may your courage honor Septimont and prove your loyalty to its spirit!

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I look forward to the rise of new heroes in this Agon.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let the Agon begin.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Come, my fellow warrior! Victory is ours for the taking!

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
You and Lupa face House Silva in the semi-finals.

Ephor Augusta gives a stirring opening speech. Now it's time to prove that true victory should be won by strength alone.

Dialogues.Speaker: Caia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Are you ready for the Gladiator's Agon?

Dialogues.Speaker: Caia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Happy hunting, Gladiators!

Dialogues.Speaker: Caia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I see. Please find me whenever you're ready.

Dialogues.Speaker: Caia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {Cus:Var,VarType=Global Key=main_team_name} versus the Bough of Legions!

Dialogues.Speaker: Caia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let the Agon begin!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let's settle this, Emilio, fair and square!

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (This frequency... it's like the Dark Tide in the Inverted Tower.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thanks, my fellow warrior.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Can't win, so you play dirty in the arena, huh?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: YOU MAKE ME SICK!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Esteemed Ephor, I must bring a grave matter to your attention.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In this very match, the Silvas stooped to underhanded tactics!

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Speak plainly, Gladiator.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This spear… it was a gift from Domina Julia, head of House Silva, when I first joined the family.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Back then, I trusted the Silvas completely, never once doubting their intentions. That is, until I chose to leave them not long ago.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now in today's arena, this spear spiraled out of control, nearly stabbing my own teammate!

Dialogues.Speaker: Julia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Of course. And your proof?

Dialogues.Speaker: Julia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Honorable Ephor, I guarantee this spear will withstand any scrutiny.

Dialogues.Speaker: Julia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Lupa, you owe your fame and fortune to our patronage. Yet, you turned your back on us when we needed you the most.

Dialogues.Speaker: Julia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Allow me to remind everyone, House Silva does not cower, nor fear defeat. In past Agons, we have constantly led in victories. Even if we lose today, we will not be expelled from Septimont.

Dialogues.Speaker: Julia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So, tell me, Lupa, who is truly desperate to destroy whom? A lone Gladiator cut off from her family... or a house as powerful as mine?
Hmph, enough of this disgrace! Stop your performance, jester!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's Iuno, the <te href=850152>Priestess</te> of Septimont. She rarely leaves the Temple and only shows up accompanying Ephor Augusta.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The heroic spirits of the moon and stars have long seen through it. These hollow lies taint Septimont's sacred arena.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Guilty.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Augusta, banish the Silvas from Septimont!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Priestess can foretell fate and has the power to make final calls here. Most people trust her judgment.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But... Iuno is a bit extreme in our line of Priestesses. Not everyone agrees with her behavior, despite her capabilities.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Guilty. The Temple has spoken.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Julia Silva, you know the weight of your actions.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I know your family once stood as the cornerstone of this city. Its pioneers, its founders, its protectors.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: For centuries, the Silvas fought bravely in the hunting grounds, defending Septimont from Tacet Discords.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But today, you dishonor their legacy. Do not disgrace them further, Julia.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Leave Septimont. Do not ever return.

Dialogues.Speaker: Julia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...As you command, Ephor.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Your performance just now... That wasn't a complete disaster. At least, you show more promise than those idiots retreating to cling to their meager points.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: An outlander... Hmph. Fight well, both of you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Do not disappoint me or Augusta in tomorrow's final.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
Lupa announces to Ephor Augusta that her weapon was tampered with, but House Silva denies the accusation.

In the standoff, Iuno, a Priestess of Septimont, declares House Silva guilty. Augusta presents evidence of Julia's secret dealings, and House Silva is expelled from Septimont.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It seems there's still some time before the other semi-final concludes. Let's head to the lounge for a break.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartur
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let me cut to the chase. The Silvas are finished.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartur
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ephor Augusta's swift decision sealed their fate. Don't tell me you had no part in this.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Heh, who's to say? How could I predict Domina Julia would tamper with my spear?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartur
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Regardless, House Silva has been banished. Even if they deceived you first, you still left their team without a word and violated your contract. You can't deny that.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Skip to the end, Cartur. You're not here to catch up or spread gossip.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartur
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Fine, then. I handled the Silvas' sponsorship of the Bough of Legions, and I can ensure the damage to your career is minimal. In return, I'll be your event manager for the next year.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Deal. But we'll need new terms. I trust you'll draw up a contract that satisfies me, Cartur?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartur
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Always ready to squeeze an opportunity, aren't you, Lupa?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Silvas lit the spark, but you turned a blind eye to what was happening. Don't fool yourself, Cartur. You're complicit in this, too.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartur
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Fine. We'll do it your way.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Wait. You didn't come to me just for money, did you?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartur
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ephor Augusta, the fiercest hunter in the grounds, our queen. If there's a storm brewing in Septimont, I intend to find the right place to take shelter.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Finally, some peace. What a day!

Options.PlotLineKey: At least we made it to the final.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ephor Augusta had a humble origin. Her path to power was paved in blood.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Decades ago, corruption ran rampant in Septimont, far worse than it is now. Two Ephors met untimely ends back then.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Great Agon carries immense weight for the city, and I guess that's why she chose this moment to act.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Priestess of Septimont has the authority to make final judgments. Iuno, in particular, is one of Ephor Augusta's staunchest allies.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Most prophets spend their days in the Temple, observing fate's flow and tending to the eternal flames.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But Iuno's different. She prefers to spend her time in the hunting grounds, bow in hand, patrolling with the other fighters.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Born during an eclipse, she's the most gifted among her line. Impressive, isn't it?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's right! I owe you for helping me escape Julia's tricks.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: After handling Cartur's invitation, Lupa rests with you in the lounge. During this time, you ask her about Ephor Augusta and Priestess Iuno. The former, hailing from humble origins, has risen to power, while the latter is rumored to possess a gift for prophecy.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (That fleeting frequency... It was similar to the Threnodian's. Could it really be linked to the Dark Tide Lupa will bring forth in Septimont, as Phrolova said?)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Lupa, can I see your spear?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Here you are!

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Hmm, I can't feel that abnormal frequency anymore...)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Lupa, does Domina Julia believe in the Sentinel?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well. If anything, she despises the Acolytes in Ragunna. Her obsession with titles is for the glory that comes with them.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: She prides herself on being the "perfect Septimontian." It's highly unlikely she'd believe in the Sentinel.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...I see.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sorry, lend me your shoulder for a moment... I'm a bit tired.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Go ahead.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well, that's settled! Looks like the other two teams have wrapped up their match. The semi-finals are over. Finally, we can leave and get some rest.

Dialogues.Speaker: Excited Spectator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Contender Lupa! Congratulations on reaching the final! Oh, and-and you, {PlayerName}, your performance earlier was truly impressive!

Dialogues.Speaker: Picky Reporter
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Lupa, did you notice any signs of match-fixing involving House Silva before? About that...

Dialogues.Speaker: Indignant Supporter
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I told you long ago! The Bough of Legions has been exploiting their Gladiators! But no one dared to speak up!

Dialogues.Speaker: Contemplating Bard
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If you win the final, you'll have the whole of <te href=850156>Solis</te> raising their drinks to your name.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Alright, alright, everyone! I'll chat with you later. But first, let's give my fellow warrior a moment to breathe, okay?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {Male=He;Female=She}'s new to Septimont. I'm sure none of you want to get carried away and leave a bad impression on an outlander, hm?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Go. Find somewhere quiet to rest. I'll meet up with you once I've dealt with all this.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
In the match just now, you sensed the presence of the Dark Tide in Lupa's weapon, unbeknownst to her.

After the semi-finals, Lupa blocks the journalists crowding around you, telling you to rest and that she'll find you later.

Chapters.Title: Find a quiet spot to ponder on the situation

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Lupa... It was the Threnodian and Dark Tide's frequencies I sensed in her weapon, if only for a brief moment.)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (She thought it was just the Silvas' dirty trick and didn't notice its connection with the Threnodian.)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
