Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Phrolova said her associate can weave fate and stories. If that's true, it means his Forte can influence how things play out.)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (But it's unlikely he can freely bend the fabric of reality. The Fractsidus would've overrun Solaris long ago if he could. Either Septimont exists outside reality, or his ability has limits.)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (If this isn't the real world, I could take more drastic actions. But if it is, killing Lupa would be an act I could never take back.)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (The best approach is to stick to my original plan. Wait for Arsinosa to appear in the final. That's my lead to Cartethyia.)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (I also sensed Cartethyia's frequency on Lupa, too. If she's here, she's making moves, just like I am.)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (In the meantime, I need to figure out that Overseer's limits. The longer this lasts, the more anomalies are bound to show.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Buling
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Boss, why the long face huh? Something getting you down?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Buling? Why are you here?

Dialogues.Speaker: Buling
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm here for sightseeing! How could I miss the Great Agon? It's Septimont's signature event!

Dialogues.Speaker: Buling
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah, you are the one to break the deadlock.

Dialogues.Speaker: Buling
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You've noticed it, haven't you, Boss? Septimont is caught in some anomaly.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How much do you know about it? This is our second time meeting, Buling. That can't be a coincidence.

Dialogues.Speaker: Buling
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I can "feel" it, but I don't know where it's coming from. Every time I get close, it slips away like smoke.

Dialogues.Speaker: Buling
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But now, I'm sure of it. If I want out of this mess, I need to borrow some of your muscle.

Dialogues.Speaker: Buling
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oyo, but Taoists have their rules, can't say too much. But helping you helps me... A little nudge is no big deal, right?

Dialogues.Speaker: Buling
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Here, take this. A little something from me to you. A good start for us. Anyway, it's on me. No charge.

Dialogues.Speaker: Buling
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Seeing isn't believing, but truth exists in the mirror of the world. Go ahead, see for yourself.

Dialogues.Speaker: Doubtful Spectator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What do you think? The final's nearly here. Will Contender Mya claim the title?

Dialogues.Speaker: Doubtful Spectator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: She's done well so far, but her track record has been shaky...

Dialogues.Speaker: Anxious Spectator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: She'd better not slip up now!

Dialogues.Speaker: Anxious Spectator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I've bet a fortune in the underground pits. If she loses, I-I...

Dialogues.Speaker: Anxious Spectator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...That John fellow promised she'd win no matter what.

Dialogues.Speaker: Doubtful Spectator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: John? Ah, Mya's manager.

Dialogues.Speaker: Doubtful Spectator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Listen, she's got all sorts of talk 'round her, and the odds are crazy. But past champions have always been the noble bloods, haven't they?

Dialogues.Speaker: Doubtful Spectator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Not to mention, she's originally from Ragunna...

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Buling? Ah, she's gone again.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (I remember Lupa mentioning a Gladiator named Mya. She disappeared years ago during a Great Agon.)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Phrolova said the story only lasts for three days and ends during the final. The Great Agon is at the heart of the story after all.)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (The bell on this <te href=850158>mirror</te> is jingling... The closer I move in that direction, the louder it gets. I'd better check it out.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
As you consider the connection between Lupa and the strange happenings in Septimont, Buling appears once more.

She tells you that she also senses the oddities around but cannot find a way to break the deadlock. She hands you a copper mirror. As you examine it, the scene shifts to reveal a conversation that occurred two decades ago during the Great Agon. Two Septimontians discuss a shadowy underground bet involving Gladiator Mya.

Chapters.Title: Use the Copper Mirror of Truth
Watch what the Copper Mirror reveals

Dialogues.Speaker: Unsatisfied Instructor
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: John, how many more times must we go through this?

Dialogues.Speaker: Unsatisfied Instructor
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I know you can't bear to lose your golden goose, but Mya's completely lost it! That woman's crossed the line!

Dialogues.Speaker: Manipulative Manager
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Easy, easy. Haven't I already compensated you? Just bear with her a little longer.

Dialogues.Speaker: Manipulative Manager
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: She's not losing it every time she steps into the arena, is she? She's just been under a lot of pressure.

Dialogues.Speaker: Unsatisfied Instructor
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ha, she's not the only one under pressure! They're planning to bring Kerasaurs into the final! Do you realize how much money is at stake?

Dialogues.Speaker: Unsatisfied Instructor
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Tell me, how can I trust a fighter like her to win the final?

Dialogues.Speaker: Manipulative Manager
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I know Mya's... unraveling. The hallucinations, the hysteria... It's been a lot.

Dialogues.Speaker: Unsatisfied Instructor
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Did you know she cries in the lounge? Can you believe it, a Gladiator in the lounge, crying!

Dialogues.Speaker: Unsatisfied Instructor
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: She can't even connect with the audience, including her fans. What use is being a great fighter if you can't hold the crowd?!

Dialogues.Speaker: Manipulative Manager
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We have no choice. The people of Septimont want to see her fight!

Dialogues.Speaker: Manipulative Manager
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If we take her out, the complaints will bury us.

Dialogues.Speaker: Manipulative Manager
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "The Star from Ragunna, the Champion of Septimont!" That headline alone prints money.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In the mirror, Mya's manager and her instructor are seen exploiting her, indifferent to her unraveling mental state.

Chapters.Title: Use the Copper Mirror of Truth
Watch what the Copper Mirror reveals

Dialogues.Speaker: Scornful Nobleman
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That Gladiator girl, Mya, was it? I hear she's got quite the following.

Dialogues.Speaker: Astute Noblewoman
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, absolutely. Everyone loves her... as long as she's winning.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scornful Nobleman
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Heh. Before the Great Agon, I remember her performance was abysmal. Hysteria, they said. Utterly unhinged.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scornful Nobleman
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: For someone with her fighting skills, it's shocking how far she fell. Her "value" plummeted to rock bottom.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scornful Nobleman
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I thought she'd be done after that, but then that John dragged her out of the mud.

Dialogues.Speaker: Astute Noblewoman
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh yes, it's tragic, really. Poor Mya.

Dialogues.Speaker: Astute Noblewoman
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: John will wring every last Credit out of her. How pitiful.

Dialogues.Speaker: Astute Noblewoman
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: My dear Lucius, you've surely heard about the underground pits by now, yes?

Dialogues.Speaker: Scornful Nobleman
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh? What are you thinking?

Dialogues.Speaker: Astute Noblewoman
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The commoners who bear grudges against the <te href=850170>Senate</te>, the vultures circling for profit... Rage simmers within them, a keg waiting to ignite.

Dialogues.Speaker: Astute Noblewoman
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They're eager for chaos, bloodshed, and sacrifice. If we simply provide the spark, we'll make a fortune while eliminating untoward risks.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scornful Nobleman
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ha! Delightful. Nothing like a bit of spectacle and strife to pass the time, is there?

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In the mirror, Septimontian nobles are seen planning to use Mya's matches as a cover to incite chaos and bloodshed to quietly solve the Senate's problems.

Chapters.Title: Use the Copper Mirror of Truth

Dialogues.Speaker: Mya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Relax, Mya. You can do this... Hold on.

Dialogues.Speaker: Mya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's alright... I'll be fine...

Dialogues.Speaker: Mya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It... It hasn't been all bad. I've met people who supported me. They cheered me on since I first stepped into the arena...

Dialogues.Speaker: Mya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But... I know my limits.

Dialogues.Speaker: Mya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No matter how much I push myself, this is as far as I'll go.

Dialogues.Speaker: Mya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I love this. Gladiating. Just stepping into the arena makes me feel... happy.

Dialogues.Speaker: Mya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But here... I can't treat it like a hobby.

Dialogues.Speaker: Mya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And... I want to be seen! To hear them cheer for me! Their laughter, their cheers... I wanna win! I wanna win so, so bad!

Dialogues.Speaker: Mya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...And I need the money.

Dialogues.Speaker: Mya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, Divinity above, I hope I won't let anyone down. I need to be better. Much, much better...

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In the mirror, Mya is seen trembling, sobbing, and digging deep to continue to fight as a Gladiator.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}!

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (For an instant, I felt it. The Threnodian's frequency again.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I've finished talking with them, let's go back. Oh, almost forgot. This is for you!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Heartpour I wanted you to try before. Chilled is the best way to have it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You need to rest before continuing this investigation. Your strength is spent.

Dialogues.Speaker: Nameless Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you for your help these past few days.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We're both from Rinascita. I'm here by the Sentinel's Will. This is simply my duty, for I was once blessed by the Sentinel.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The blessings and freedoms They grant... I wish to share them with everyone across these islands.

Dialogues.Speaker: Nameless Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Tidal Blight is spreading faster. I'm afraid—

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's okay. Do not let it break you. One thing is certain. This anomaly stems from a specific power. Some facilities and records have been rewound nearly two decades back.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We just need to find out why and who's responsible.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The clock is ticking, but we still have a chance.

Dialogues.Speaker: Nameless Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The mastermind behind this will be tricky to deal with.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Don't worry. I'll handle it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Compared to the darkness that once whispered in my ears, a tangible enemy is easier to face.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Besides, the Righteous One will notice this anomaly when {Male=he;Female=she} arrives. Our moves so far will guide {Male=him;Female=her} forward.

Dialogues.Speaker: Nameless Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You really trust {Male=him;Female=her}, don't you?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes, very much. We correct each other's mistakes and walk the path of salvation together.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Trust in yourself too. One day, you will reclaim your name.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As for those vile intentions lurking in the Dark Tide, we'll cut them off together.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now, shall we continue the investigation? Are you ready?

Dialogues.Speaker: Nameless Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Absolutely.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ugh, this is so exhausting! Dealing with these headaches takes more energy than fighting in the arena.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What is it? You're radiating worry.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If it's about tomorrow's final, maybe you should relax a bit.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Lupa, can you tell me more about Mya?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sure, but why the sudden interest?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Just curious. I overheard some people talking about her earlier.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well, Contender Mya... I first heard about her from Domina Julia.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Julia didn't like her. Probably because they once competed in the same Agon. Mya disappeared after claiming the title, leaving that Agon without an official champion.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "An ignorant fool." That's how Julia described her. Back then, I'd just been "purchased" by the Silvas, and I got curious about the story.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Turns out, Mya spent almost all her time out of the arena training. Beyond the barest of needs, she devoted herself to honing her craft.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That kind of dedication wasn't... well-regarded in Septimont back then.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Rumor has it she got caught in dirty match-fixing, cracked under the pressure, and ran.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Everyone has their breaking point. If she ran because of it, I don't blame her.

Options.PlotLineKey: What about you? Are you not tired?
But you seem to enjoy gladiating.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well, maybe I just handle these things better, or maybe I just don't care about people's expectations.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm not above the commercial events. It's how I made a name for myself, built my worth. As long as I'm in the arena, I'm happy.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Applause comes and goes. But the things that matter... facilities, resources, opportunities, they don't come cheap.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Septimont has its shadows, but some things still have to get done.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I don't mind being used, as long as whoever I work with knows where the line is.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I know it's easy to turn a blind eye to the dirty games, but that's just handing Septimont over to the vultures.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Silvas played dirty in the arena I hold dear. They trampled over a line that should never be crossed. So we're done.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Look at it... How beautiful.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: To the great City of Septimont.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
It is unclear whether the visions in the copper mirror are reality or illusion. However, when you meet Lupa again you once more glimpse her transform into that same strange young woman. This time, you recognize her as Mya.

You return to the hotel with Lupa and ask her about Mya. She shares everything she knows, including the glamorous and dark aspects of Gladiating in Septimont.

In a side of the city unseen, Cartethyia once visited this very same room with the Nameless One.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
Lupa speaks with you a little longer before leaving. The flood of new information leaves you weary, and you quickly fall asleep.
When the sun rises, the day of the finals arrives.

Chapters.Title: Leave the hotel room and go to the Colosseum

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Today's the final! Let's go!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: May victory be ours, and may you find the one you've been searching for.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}, look over there! That's Arsinosa!

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (So that's the Guardian Echo of Septimont...)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (...But there's something different about this Arsinosa compared to the one I saw confronting Cartethyia.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh... Hold on, I forgot to tell you something yesterday about Mya.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Decades ago, during the Great Agon, Mya disappeared on her way to receive the award. But before that, she did claim the title of the Bloody Agon and even received Arsinosa's blessing.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The current two-on-two matchup was only introduced thanks to Augusta and her predecessor.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Before that, the matches were... far more brutal.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Gladiators were thrown into a chaotic free-for-all. To hype up the event, the organizers would unleash hordes of Tacet Discords into the arena. The last Gladiator standing was crowned the victor.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: At least, changes have been made since then!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Refined by flames and tempests, all that endures eventually becomes part of Septimont's legacy.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The day of the final is here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Arsinosa watches, and her significance is known to every Septimontian. It is etched in chronicles and sung in legends.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If you seek the glory of Arsinosa's blessing, then fight with everything you have!

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Show me if any of you four possess the strength to earn the Guardian's recognition.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Listen, {PlayerName}! Those cheers are for us! They wait for us to give them a fight to remember!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Are you ready to win this with me?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Wonderful! Now it's hunting time, my fellow warrior!

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
Lupa tells you that before the new Ephor took office, Septimont's Gladiator matches were far bloodier and more brutal.

"The Bloody Agon," it was called. As you mull over the term, you prepare to enter the finals with Lupa.

Dialogues.Speaker: Caia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Are you ready for the Gladiator's Agon?

Dialogues.Speaker: Caia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Happy hunting, Gladiators!

Dialogues.Speaker: Caia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I see. Find me whenever you're ready.

Dialogues.Speaker: Caia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {Cus:Var,VarType=Global Key=main_team_name} versus Beasts Beneath!

Dialogues.Speaker: Caia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let the Agon begin!

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Strange. I feel that same tangled, colliding sensation again...

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Lupa...?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The guardian that once protected the glory of Septimont now reduced to this. Tragic.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The formidable power once wielded to guard Septimont is now tainted by the Dark Tide.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I will grant you release... and uncover the mastermind behind this chaos!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What's wrong? You seem like you're... somewhere else.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Lupa, how did we win?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Er... we defeated our opponents?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I see...

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (The Bloody Agon I experienced definitely wasn't a dream. It was like the real world overlapped with the anomalous one.)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (I kept seeing Lupa and Mya overlap with each other as well.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Brilliant performance, warriors.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Remember, this is more than just a title. It is a testament to your own strength and wisdom in overcoming your opponents. You've earned the right to claim it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This medal once belonged to a single champion, the last survivor standing in the ring.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I divided it into two to remind you that...

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Just as we fight alongside Echoes, the glory of Septimont is upheld by heroes who support one another to remain steadfast.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Fighting alone is commendable. However, true strength lies in protecting those beside you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The High Tide draws near. I want all warriors heading to the hunting grounds to remember this.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm? That's interesting.

Dialogues.Speaker: Iuno
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Augusta, look! Another two have earned Arsinosa's blessing.

Dialogues.Speaker: Augusta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You've done incredibly well.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As a Gladiator, it's a great honor to claim the title with you, {PlayerName}.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let's savor this moment of glory and joy!

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You plotted this tragedy.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No, Madam. I wouldn't take all the credit.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The architects of this tragedy were the Septimontians themselves. A collective murder so entertainingly woven. With blood on every hand, who's left to point a finger?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But I must admit, I'm astonished you would endure all this for strangers and lands you've never set foot on.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I don't need any grand reason to slay a villain like you. The Threnodian once sought to pull the entire Rinascita into the Dark Tide, but It failed.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And so will you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Heh... Madam, surely you know you alone cannot undo my story.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Alone? {PlayerName} will come here and find a way to finish this.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And I will make your so-called perfect play spiral out of control.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Silent, hollow words...

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Dark Tide engulfing the City of Glory...

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: All shall be swept away by the winds at the story's end!

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
You and Lupa emerge victorious, but the strange events you just experienced go unnoticed by the crowds.

Meanwhile, in an unknown place, Cartethyia steps into the same arena, her sword aimed at the playwright Cristoforo.

You and Cartethyia stand together, unknowingly united in the light and shadow of glory, fighting side by side in a battle that no one is aware of. The story is far from over.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}, I'll be waiting for you at the end of the story.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lupa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Victory is ours, fellow warrior!
